PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
The research themes are the design of exact or approximate algorithms for solving problems in networks, in particular wireless networks. The problems that we will consider can be modelled in terms of graphs, more precisely into graph colouring or graph decomposition problems. We will more specifically study the following problems. 1) Channel assignment in radio networks which can be modelled by various graph colouring problems; 2) Dynamic routing in wireless networks using microwave links; Concurrently to this researches, we develop the libraries Mascopt and Parego, an common interface of which has been jointly implemented.We will incorporate several algorithms we will obtain in order to compare their theoretical and practical efficiencies.
Page web: http://www-sop.inria.fr/teams/mascotte/equipeassociee/ewin/EWIN11.html
Observation: One of 05 "equipes associйes" of INRIA in Brazil, during the period.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
A Escola (http://www.lia.ufc.br/scho2001/) foi realizada em duas semanas, com o Primeiro GRACO entre as duas. Os palestrantes principais ministraram mini-cursos de 10 horas para um publico de aproximadamente 120 pessoas. O texto preparado para os mini-cursos deram origem a um livro "Recent Advanced in Combinatorics and Algorithms" editado pelos organizadores.
Os palestrantes foram: Laszlo Lovasz William Pulleyblanck Colin McDiarmid Bruce Reed Frederic Maffray Angelika Steger Yoshiko Wakabaiashi Jayme Swarcfiter Michel Habib Clбudio Lucchesi Marie-France Sagot Yoshiharu Kohayakawa Victor Neumann-Lara

Afonso Ferreira (CNRS, COST-ESF, Bйlgica) Adrian Vetta (Department of Mathematics and Statistics, McGill University, Canada) Bruce Reed (Departament of Computer Science, McGill University, Canada) Frйdйric Havet (CNRS-INRIA, Projet Mascotte, Sophia-Antipolis, Franca) Maria Chudnovski (Department of Mathematics, University of Princenton, EUA) Michel Goemans (Departament of Applied Mathematics, MIT, EUA) Paul Seymour (Department of Mathematics, University of Princenton, EUA)
